record.field: The Initial Configuration state is for servers that have not been deployed. Or that having been deployed in the past have been deleted.
The Waiting for Deployment state is a transitional state and should only appear while the cloud provider is setting up the VM.
The Active state is when the VM has been deployed by the cloud provider and is fully functional.
The Waiting for Script Action state is a transitional state, and should appear only after a wizard or button event has taken place that causes a template script to run on a given server.
The Waiting for Stop is a transitional state, and should only appear while the cloud provider is stopping the VM.
The Waiting for Delete is a transitional state, and should only appear while the cloud provider is deleting the VM.
The Waiting for Reboot is a transitional state, and should only appear while the cloud provider is rebooting the VM.
The Stopped state is when the VM has been stopped by the cloud provider.
